TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {182187=Penn Law students receive unparalleled support from staff and faculty in their pursuit of judicial clerkships. And today, recent clerkship placements are at the highest levels in our history. For the years 2009-14, our students and alumni secured 415 clerkships at all levels., 122866=This information is based on student survey responses, ABA and NALP data, and reflects employment as of the February 15 following graduation for the classes of 2010-2013 and as of the March 15 following graduation for the class of 2014. Please note that the judicial clerkship chart reflects a different time period and includes alumni. }
textBeforeTable: This information is based on student survey responses, ABA and NALP data, and reflects employment as of the February 15 following graduation for the classes of 2010-2013 and as of the March 15 following graduation for the class of 2014. Please note that the judicial clerkship chart reflects a different time period and includes alumni.  The Penn Law experience enables our graduates to pursue successful and fulfilling careers, even in uncertain economic times. The data below attests to our continued success in the market. textAfterTable: Penn Law’s cross-disciplinary JD program prepares students for a range of careers in the law and related fields, complemented by professional development programs that build skills necessary to pursue the best jobs and careers. At Penn Law, students are exposed to the widest variety of legal employers, nationally and internationally, as well as to Penn alumni worldwide who have used their law degrees to push the boundaries in their fields.
